item.title: French govt. says users of uBlock Origin, Signal etc. are potential terrorists
item.description: - The French government has labeled users of privacy-focused technologies like uBlock Origin and Signal as potential terrorists.

item.title: Dear Red Hat: Are you dumb?
item.description: - Red Hat has made the decision to lock down the sources of their Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) distribution, angering many users who relied on its compatibility with other distributions.

item.title: How to do the thing you've been avoiding
item.description: - Sometimes, the things we think are bad ideas may actually turn out to be our greatest assets.

item.title: Mistakes to avoid to build a better 1-person business
item.description: - Solo-founders should avoid businesses that require scale and massive numbers of users, as it's difficult to attract and maintain a large customer base without a budget or network effects.

item.title: Now Reddit are coming for the individual personal subreddits
item.description: - Reddit is implementing new policies that are causing concerns among users, particularly regarding the re-assignment of moderators and the potential loss of personal subreddits.

item.title: Debris found came from missing Titan sub, says friend of passengers
item.description: - The mothership of the missing Titan sub, called the Polar Prince, is returning to St John's, Newfoundland, Canada.

item.title: Svelte 4
item.description: - Svelte 4 has been released, bringing updates to performance, developer experience, and the website.

item.title: Revolt: FOSS Discord Alternative
item.description: - Revolt is a new alternative to Discord, a popular chat app, that focuses on user privacy and customization.

item.title: People paid to train AI are outsourcing their work to AI
item.description: - A new study has found that a significant proportion of workers paid to train AI models are actually outsourcing their work to AI itself.

item.title: Thoughts on Svelte(Kit), one year & 3B requests later
